qas.question: How many official languages does Cyprus have?
What are the two official languages of Cyprus?
What are the minority languages are spoken in Cyprus?
Are there any Western languages spoken in Cyprus?
Are there any Eastern languages spoken in Cyprus?

context: Cyprus has <a0_0>two<a0_0/> official languages, <a1_0>Greek and Turkish<a1_0/>. <a2_0>Armenian and Cypriot Maronite Arabic<a2_0/> are recognised as minority languages. Although without official status, <a3_0>English<a3_0/> is widely spoken and it features widely on road signs, public notices, and in advertisements, etc. English was the sole official language during British colonial rule and the lingua franca until 1960, and continued to be used (de facto) in courts of law until 1989 and in legislation until 1996. 80.4% of Cypriots are proficient in the English language as a second language. <a4_0>Russian<a4_0/> is widely spoken among the country's minorities, residents and citizens of post-Soviet countries, and Pontic Greeks. Russian, after English and Greek, is the third language used on many signs of shops and restaurants, particularly in Limassol and Paphos. In addition to these languages, 12% speak French and 5% speak German.
